thread.title: Rob Gronkowski tries to simultaneously hold all 5 of the Patriots' Super Bowl trophies—and nearly drops one
thread.title_full: Rob Gronkowski tries to simultaneously hold all 5 of the Patriots' Super Bowl trophies—and nearly drops one

title: Rob Gronkowski tries to simultaneously hold all 5 of the Patriots' Super Bowl trophies—and nearly drops one
text:
The Patriots have so many Super Bowl trophies, not even Rob Gronkowski can hold them all.
After their victory parade Tuesday in Boston, the team — now tied for the second most Super Bowl titles in league history — took the celebration down to Providence for a rally at the Dunkin’ Donuts Center. And perhaps it’s a symbol of the Patriots’ success that not even the team’s giant 6-foot-6 tight end can hold them all at once.
Not that he wasn’t going to try. Though Gronk’s attempt to hold them nearly ended in disaster.
Ain't no party like a @RobGronkowski party…. #Patriots (via @NBC10 ) pic.twitter.com/FJOpovauol
— AndreaWBZ (@AndreaWBZ) February 7, 2017
Fortunately, the sure-handed tight end was able to make the save. Check out the reverse angle to see the moment of panic flash across Gronk’s face.
So @RobGronkowski had this place going wild at the @DunkinDonutsCtr #Patriots #SuperBowl pic.twitter.com/k6HtJNgIu9
— Joe Kayata (@NBC10_Joe) February 7, 2017
Rob Gronkowski nearly drops on of the Lombardi Trophies at the celebration at the Dunk. @projo @ProjoPhoto pic.twitter.com/2PZZwFQTL0
— Glenn Osmundson (@GlennOsmundson) February 7, 2017
Gronk is having fun.
This place is going nuts right now #Patriots pic.twitter.com/DjBj2uFl5c
— Joe Kayata (@NBC10_Joe) February 7, 2017
